basics.name: William Macfarlane
basics.label: Founder+Co-Director Parts and Crafts, Teacher, Designer, Developer
basics.summary: I design, develop, and facilitate tools, spaces, communities, and experiences through which people of all ages can build, play, make, teach, and learn together.

work.summary: Founded and directed a youth and community makerspace and alternative education center serving 1100 children annually in a variety of programs in and out of school.
highlights: Designed  and facillitated student-directed creative learning spaces in the form of school-vacation camps, afterschool and evening open-shop programs, in-school workshops and partnerships, and a five day/week school-alternative program.
Taught classes and and workshops and developed cross-disciplinary curriculum on art, technology, design, and other topics to students age 7 to adult.
Developed and managed a $500,000 annual organizational budget through a mixture of grant-writing, fundraising, project-kit sales and program revenue.
Co-designed organizational policies, practices and procedures with a team of 5 other full-time program staff.
Co-managed a community wood-shop and digital fabrication lab and developed practices and procedures governing youth and community tool use.
Designed hands-on, project-based tinkering and building professional development workshops for educators.
Participated in and bottom-lined every aspect of running and managing a small non-profit, from accounting to IT to licensing to community management to building maintenance.

work.company: Public Laboratory for Open Technology and Science
work.summary: Volunteer organizer for DIY Civic Science
highlights: Ran community workshops and outreach events focused on developing and using DIY open-hardware environmental monitoring tools to citizen science and environmental justice initiatives.
Developed project documentation and workshop curriculum supporting the building and use of these tools.
Designed and developed small software design tools built around computational geometry, complexity, and models of physical processes.
Developed a combination public-face/private collaboration tool/website to facillitate information sharing between collaborators and the public.

awards.title: “Bringing Making Into Education” Panel
awards.summary: Panelist in discussion on how the “maker movement” can support the development of self-directed learners.

awards.title: Hack My Nonprofit: Public Lab
awards.summary: Panelist and presenter in discussion on making, citizen science, and breaking the barrier between teachers and learners.

awards.title: Free Schools, Makerspaces, and Self-Directed Learning
awards.summary: Co-presenter with Katie Gradowski on on Parts and Crafts, self-directed education, and the “maker movement” in schools with a focus on diversity and accessibility.

awards.title: Some Formal Mechanisms to Support Informal Learning
awards.summary: A short talk on the structure and design of self-directed learning spaces and communities.  Presented as part of a series of curated lightning talks organized by Molly DeBlanc entitled 'Some People Worth Listening To.'

awards.title: Start Right Now!
awards.summary: Panelist in discussion facillitated by Ken Danforth on the logistics and process of starting school alternatives.

awards.title: “How To Start a Youth Makerspace”
awards.summary: Panelist in discussion facillitated by Jeff Sturges on how (and why!) to start a youth makerspace in your community.
